protocol_name: The Healthy Brain Network Serial Scanning Initiative, Sessions 2-7 and 9-14
protocol_name_html: The Healthy Brain Network Serial Scanning Initiative, Sessions 2-7 and 9-14
description:
This protocol describes MRI, voice recoding, and some basic physiological measurements and questionnaires for Sessions 2-7 and 9-14 of the following work:

 

David O'Connor, et. al. (2017) The Healthy Brain Network Serial Scanning Initiative. GigaScience...
before_start: Participant offered use of restroom, preganancy test administered to female participants on V14 if they are of childbearing age, and consent is acquired

collections.protocol_name: Protocols for The Healthy Brain Network Serial Scanning Initiative (Sessions 1-14)
collections.protocol_name_html: Protocols for The Healthy Brain Network Serial Scanning Initiative (Sessions 1-14)

authors: David O'Connor, Natan Vega Potler, Meagan Kovacs,Ting Xu, Lei Ai, John Pellman, Tamara Vanderwal, Lucas Parra, Samantha Cohen, Satrajit Ghosh, Jasmine Escalera, Natalie Grant-Villegas, Yael Osman, Anastasia Bui, R Cameron Craddock, Michael P Milham

components.data: Internal State Questionnaire - 3-item self-report questionnaire assessing hunger and thirst. Participants respond on a visual analogue scale ranging from "I am not hungry/thirsty/full at all" to "I have never been more hungry/thirsty/full". Responses are rated from 0-100. Participants complete this questionnaire before and after each scan.
components.name: Description

Participants complete this questionnaire before and after each scan.

components.data: Audio samples of participant speech were recorded prior to scanning. Each sample consisted of 10 sentences with 5 different implicit emotions (neutral, happy, sad, angry, fearful), 10 non-words, and 2 minutes of free speech. For each sample different sentences were drawn from the same set of emotions; the non-words also differed in each sample but had similar characteristics (ie number of syllables, chunks). Stimuli were presented on a laptop computer screen. Completion of the sample took up to 15 minutes.
components.name: Description

components.data: Internal State Questionnaire - 3-item self-report questionnaire assessing hunger and thirst. Participants respond on a visual analogue scale ranging from "I am not hungry/thirsty/full at all" to "I have never been more hungry/thirsty/full". Responses are rated from 0-100. Participants complete this questionnaire before and after each scan.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Internal State Questionnaire - 3-item self-report questionnaire assessing hunger and thirst. Participants respond on a visual analogue scale ranging from "I am not hungry/thirsty/full at all" to "I have never been more hungry/thirsty/full". Responses are rated from 0-100. Participants complete this questionnaire before and after each scan.

components.data: New York Cognition Questionnaire - 31-item self-report questionnaire that asks participants about the different thoughts and feelings that they may have had while in the MRI scan. Participants are asked to indicate the extent to which their thinking or experience corresponded to each item on a 9-point scale.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: New York Cognition Questionnaire - 31-item self-report questionnaire that asks participants about the different thoughts and feelings that they may have had while in the MRI scan. Participants are asked to indicate the extent to which their thinking or experience corresponded to each item on a 9-point scale.

components.data: PANAS - The PANAS-S is a self-administered, 20-item Likert scale assessment that measures degree of positive or negative affect. Users are asked to rate 10 adjectives that measure positive feelings such as joy or pleasure, and 10 adjectives that measure negative feelings, such as anxiety or sadness, on a scale of how closely the adjective describes them in the present moment or over the past week. Items are rated on a five-point scale.
components.name: Description

Items are rated on a five-point scale.

components.data: Quotient (on V9 only) - Quotient is a computer based task designed to assess three core symptoms of ADHD: hyperactivity, attention and impulsivity. Participants respond to stimuli presented with random timing and random placement on a screen. Completion of the task takes up to 30 minutes.
components.name: Description
